intro: Monnina macroclada, commonly known as the largeleaf monnina, is a herbaceous annual plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Polygalaceae and is characterized by its slender stems and small, clustered leaves. The plant produces delicate pink to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Monnina macroclada thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. It is considered a valuable plant for native landscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental appeal.
